body:
I don't think the homebrew stuff is relevant. If you ran `npm install` to get the package, it should have downloaded or built the extension, unless you somehow prevented it from doing so.

It would help if you could run `npm install grpc` again in your `/Users/tejas/dev/src/github.com/segment-sources/stripe` and, if that doesn't fix the problem, provide the output of that command.

```
Tejass-MacBook-Pro:stripe tejas$ node -v
v6.3.1
Tejass-MacBook-Pro:stripe tejas$ npm i

> dtrace-provider@0.6.0 install /Users/tejas/dev/src/github.com/segment-sources/stripe/node_modules/dtrace-provider
> node scripts/install.js


> gc-stats@1.0.0 install /Users/tejas/dev/src/github.com/segment-sources/stripe/node_modules/gc-stats
> node-gyp rebuild

  CXX(target) Release/obj.target/gcstats/src/gcstats.o
  SOLINK_MODULE(target) Release/gcstats.node
clang: warning: libstdc++ is deprecated; move to libc++ with a minimum deployment target of OS X 10.9

> grpc@1.0.0 install /Users/tejas/dev/src/github.com/segment-sources/stripe/node_modules/grpc
> node-pre-gyp install --fallback-to-build

[grpc] Success: "/Users/tejas/dev/src/github.com/segment-sources/stripe/node_modules/grpc/src/node/extension_binary/grpc_node.node" is installed via remote
```

@murgatroid99 Required an `npm rebuild`. Not sure why

"npm rebuild" worked for me as well. I was experiencing this type of error while deploying to Firebase from the command line. It suggested I run npm install in my functions directory, and I did but that didn't solve the problem.

After installing every package npm was WARN ing about, I used "npm rebuild", then when I ran "firebase deploy" again it worked.

I wish I would have know about "npm rebuild" before installing a bunch of packages that had WARN next to the output in the terminal. I'm still a bit new to npm and my use of the force is not as strong as others. yet.
